parameters.name: FileName
parameters.description: Name of the file that has the coordinates information; can be an empty string (see Remarks )

parameters.name: PointArr
parameters.description: Array of x, y coordinate points (see Remarks )

parameters.name: UseCentrod
parameters.description: True to use the centroid of the seed feature, face, or body; false to use another point as the reference point (see Remarks )

parameters.name: GeomPatt
parameters.description: True to pattern the geometry, false to not

title: IFeatureManager.IInsertTableDrivenPattern
signature:
Feature IInsertTableDrivenPattern( 
   System.String
FileName
,
   System.Int32
Count
,
   ref System.Double
PointArr
,
   System.Boolean
UseCentrod
,
   System.Boolean
GeomPatt
)

parameters.name: FileName
parameters.description: Name of the file that has the coordinates information; can be an empty string (see Remarks )

parameters.name: PointArr
parameters.description: Array of x, y coordinate points (see Remarks )

parameters.name: UseCentrod
parameters.description: True to use the centroid of the seed feature, face, or body; false to use another point as the reference point (see Remarks )

parameters.name: GeomPatt
parameters.description: True to pattern the geometry, false to not

remarks:
You can specify:
coordinates for the input points in system units in a
.sldptab
or
.txt
file for FileName.
- or -
input points in system units in PointArr. Because each point has two coordinates (x, y), the size of PointArr is (2 x number_of_points).
This method requires selecting the input entities using these selection marks:
4 = Seed feature
16 = Coordinate system
32 = Reference point
128 = Seed face
256 = Seed body
If UseCentrod is false, then you must specify a reference point.
See the SOLIDWORKS Help for more information about table-driven patterns.
